channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hurricane Beryl Intensifies to Category 5 in the Caribbean
item.description: Officials said the storm caused extreme damage to islands in Grenada and St. Vincent and the Grenadines. No storm has become a Category 5 this early in the season.

item.title: Hurricane Beryl Intensifies to Category 5 in the Caribbean
item.description: Officials said the storm caused extreme damage to islands in Grenada and St. Vincent and the Grenadines. No storm has become a Category 5 this early in the season.

item.title: A WFH ‘culture war’ has broken out across Europe, with the U.K. leading the charge as the most WFH-friendly country, while France lags behind
item.description: Where in Europe is WFH winning?

item.title: France, With Elections, Is Headed for Disaster
item.description: The stakes have never been higher.

item.title: Patients Evacuated From Khan Younis Hospital
item.description: Dr. Mohammed Harara, who sees patients at the European Hospital in Khan Younis, Gaza, shared videos with The New York Times showing wounded patients being transferred to ambulances following evacuation orders in the area.

item.title: GE extends CEO Larry Culp’s contract through at least 2027 after successful turnaround—taking him out of the running to lead Boeing
item.description: Culp had been cited by analysts and others as a candidate to succeed Boeing’s Dave Calhoun, who has said he plans to step down by the end of the year.

item.title: Keir Starmer Is on the Cusp of Power in the U.K.
item.description: The Labour leader still struggles with the “performative side” of British politics, even as he has pulled his party to the center.

item.title: Keir Starmer Is on the Cusp of Power in the U.K.
item.description: The Labour leader still struggles with the “performative side” of British politics, even as he has pulled his party to the center.

item.title: GameStop investor drops pump-and-dump lawsuit against ‘Roaring Kitty’ just 3 days after filing it
item.description: In a court filing late Monday afternoon, Radev said he was voluntarily dismissing the lawsuit.

item.title: Air Europa Flight Hits Severe Turbulence, Fracturing Necks and Skulls
item.description: Four passengers were in intensive care after the flight from Spain to Uruguay hit turbulence that injured dozens. The plane made an emergency landing in Brazil.

item.title: Tuesday Briefing
item.description: Here’s what you need to know.

item.title: Australians now need a prescription to buy a vape under new ‘world-leading’ law
item.description: The law restricts vape sales to pharmacies and will temporarily require a doctor’s prescription for the buyer.

item.title: There’s No Reason to Resign Ourselves to Biden
item.description: The president’s team should stop gaslighting us.

item.title: Air Europa Flight Hits Severe Turbulence, Fracturing Necks and Skulls
item.description: Four passengers were in intensive care after the flight from Spain to Uruguay hit turbulence that injured dozens. The plane made an emergency landing in Brazil.

item.title: Butter prices jump to all-time high as more dairy producers shift to cheese while bird flu keeps U.S. output tight
item.description: Prices hit an average of $7,350 per metric ton on the latest Global Dairy Trade auction, surpassing a previous peak of $7,086 in 2022.
